resources.string: \ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.
Idea about a data structure for dictionary implementation from:
Ideas about Dictionary implementation on a phone from:
Opening a text file from the assets folder on Android from:

This is a word-search game. You have 45 seconds to find as many words as possible in the word matrix. The letters can be selected contiguously in any direction except diagonally. When you select a word, the letters at those places are replaced by new letters. Each letter in a valid word has the value of 10 points. You can also press the \'Hint\' button to enable the hint mode. With hint mode enabled, the letters would turn green if you have found a word even if you have not lifted your finger. They would not if the hint mode is disabled. Good luck.

Synchronous or Asynchronous Gameplay definitions from:

Please enter the name of the player you wish to play with after clicking the \"Invite Someone to play\" button. If the user is online, he will receive a dialog box with the option to accept or decline your request. [This is a just test code, multiplayer gameplay is not available yet!]

Please enter the name of the player you wish to play with after clicking the \"Invite Someone to play\" button. If the user is online, he will receive a dialog box with the option to accept or decline your request. After the game starts, you have 45 seconds to make as many words as possible and beat your opponent.

This is a turn-based game. When you invite a player, he will receive a notification (if he is logged in) clicking on which he can start the game. After the game starts, you have 6 moves to get as high a score as possible. The game has to be completed in one go. That means if both the players exit the game, then the game gets lost. The player who sent the invite is only able to enter into the game when the other player plays the first move. The player with the higher score after 6 moves to win the game.
Shake the phone for a surprise. You will be taken to either the Real-Time word game or the Turn-Based word game. Have fun playing!
Leaderboard for Two Player Word Game
Please click on the \"Logout Previous User\" Button before logging in

Let's Talk Workouts! 


Have you ever felt the need of an app that could record details about your weight training workout exercises at the gym? What if you could simply talk to your phone about the exercises? 


“Lets talk Workouts!” now does that for you. 


It lets you record details each exercise, such as exercise name, number of reps and pounds lifted, in your weight training workout session through speech. 


You can also view details of all your previous workouts. The app motivates you by telling you the increase in pounds that you have lifted compared to the maximum weight lifted by you previously for an exercise. 


Rajat Malhotra (malhotra.r@husky.neu.edu) 
 Arpit Mehta (mehta.ar@husky.neu.edu).
Click On Dates To View Details

• Phone Models Used For Testing: Galaxy S4, HTC One X 

 • Android Speech Recognition as a service on Android 4.1 and 4.2: 
 http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14940657/android-speech-recognition-as-a-service-on-android-4-1-4-2 

 • How to keep speech recognition running indefinitely: 
 http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10182893/can-i-keep-the-speech-recognizer-listening-indefinitely 

 • Soundex class, that encodes a string into a Soundex value. Soundex is an encoding used to relate similar names, but can also be used as a general purpose scheme to find word with similar phonemes. This class is thread-safe. 
 http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/apidocs/org/apache/commons/codec/language/Soundex.html 

 • Professional Android Sensor Programming Text Book. Specifically Chapters 18 and 19, which helped us understand Speech Recognition and provided us with detailed examples of how to use Speech Recognition and audio sensors 

 • App Icon: 
 http://www.easyicon.net/language.en/iconsearch/people/5/ 

 • Database of exercises was constructed from: 
 http://www.bodybuilding.com 

 • Android Developers Blog: An introduction to Text-To-Speech in Android. 
 http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2009/09/introduction-to-text-to-speech-in.html
How To Use Lets Talk Workouts!

Hi! Welcome to Lets Talk Workouts. Have you ever felt the need of an app that could record details about your weight training workout exercises at the gym? What if you could simply talk to your phone about the exercises? “Lets talk Workouts!” now does that for you. It lets you record details each exercise, such as exercise name, number of reps and pounds lifted, in your weight training workout session through speech. You can also view details of all your previous workouts. The app motivates you by telling you the increase in pounds that you have lifted compared to the maximum weight lifted by you previously for an exercise.

When you click on the Begin Workout Button, the app will first prompt you to speak I just did and will begin listening. Once you have spoken I Just Did, the app asks you for the exercise name. After you have spoken the exercise name, the app will ask you for reps followed by pounds. Once you have spoken all these details, the app will prompt you to speak either Save, to save the details, or Cancel, to cancel the entry. You can also speak Cancel anytime if the speech has been incorrectly recognized to go back to the first state where you have to speak I just did. Kindly make sure that you speak only after the beep which follows each prompt from the app. You can also input exercise details data by clicking on the Add Exercise Manually button on the Begin Workout Screen. To view the exercises supported by the app, click on View Supported Exercises button on the app\'s main screen. To view all your previous workouts, click on the View Previous Workouts Button on the app\'s main screen. Here you can click on the dates which will take you to the workouts performed on that specific date. You\'re now ready to begin your workout session. Click on Go Back To Begin Workout Button.
